Seminar Description: This seminar will explore unique topics from contemporary financial news as a way to learn about market concepts and how they function. Students will learn about these interesting (and occasionally bizarre) stories to glean concepts and then extend those ideas to understand markets more broadly. Example topics may include: meteorologists employed by hedge funds, NFTs, high frequency trading, the music rights to Taylor Swift's master tapes, how the price of oil went negative, investments in sports teams and players, how a major investment bank accidentally wired $900 million, and why the largest electric car company on the planet might not be ESG friendly.


Instructor: Josh Khalif is a Senior Institutional Trader at Flow Traders, one of the largest quantitative market making firms. Josh is involved in the trading of several asset classes across the firm, working with clients to trade ETFs, equities, bonds, ADRs, and cryptocurrencies. In addition to being an industry speaker and author, he also serves on the Digital Asset Advisory Committee for FTSE Russell. Josh graduated from Emory University in 2017 where he was in the Goizueta Business School and also majored in English in the College of Arts & Sciences. He is currently pursuing a Masters degree in Creative Writing and Literature through Harvard's Extension School.
